roleset.name: to incline or cause to incline
roleset.note: LEAN-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of Vncls assuming_position-50, put_spatial-9.2-1, spatial_configuration-47.6. (from lean.01-v)

example.name: agentive
example.text: I had to reach back to French 101 when-1 the monsieur avec clipboard leaned over my shoulder during the coffee phase of dinner *trace*-1 and asked whether I wanted to ride in a montgolfiere .
example.arg: during the coffee phase of dinner

example.name: intransitive with Arg1
example.text: The remainder of the house leans precariously against a sturdy oak tree .

example.name: lean against
example.text: `` Country people breed pigs , '' says [Mr. Chojnowski]-2 , [*-2]leaning against the back of his truck .
example.arg: against the back of his truck

example.name: lean to
example.text: The 45-year-old Mr. Giuliani has run a negative campaign [*-1] to pick up votes leaning to Mr. Dinkins .

example.name: lean toward
example.text: Many economists see even slower GNP growth for the remainder of the year , with some leaning more strongly toward a possible recession .

example.name: non-prepositional Arg2
example.text: If these assumptions hold , [voters in races for Congress]-1 face what in economic theory is called a prisoner 's dilemma and have an incentive , at the margin , [*]-1 to lean Democratic .

example.name: lean forward
example.text: Customers lean forward , rest their knees on side supports and bury their face in padding on the back of the chair .

example.name: All args
example.text: He leaned his rifle against the wall
